private_information: I am the left peg and I currently hold disks A B C D E from top to bottom, where A is the smallest and E is the largest.
left_peg.goal: Provide a concise description of my initial stack and local placement constraints so the orchestrator can build a global plan.

private_information: I am the middle peg and I am currently empty.
middle_peg.goal: Provide a concise description of my initial stack and local placement constraints so the orchestrator can build a global plan.

private_information: I am the right peg and I am currently empty.
right_peg.goal: Provide a concise description of my initial stack and local placement constraints so the orchestrator can build a global plan.

orchestrator.goal: Generate a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that moves the entire tower from the left peg to the right peg while respecting Tower of Hanoi rules.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left middle and right.
There are five disks labeled A B C D E from smallest A to largest E.
Only one disk may be moved at a time and a larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has disks from top to bottom A B C D E, middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: right peg should have disks from top to bottom A B C D E and left and middle pegs should be empty.

observe.system_prompt: You are an observer representing the left peg. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a clear and concise statement of the peg identity the disks present listed top to bottom and the local legal placement constraint that no larger disk can be placed on a smaller one.
observe.prompt: Your name is left_peg. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->left_peg->private_information} and the agent goal {agents->left_peg->goal} to produce a short, precise state description suitable for the orchestrator.

observe.system_prompt: You are an observer representing the middle peg. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a clear and concise statement of the peg identity the disks present listed top to bottom and the local legal placement constraint that no larger disk can be placed on a smaller one.
observe.prompt: Your name is middle_peg. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->middle_peg->private_information} and the agent goal {agents->middle_peg->goal} to produce a short, precise state description suitable for the orchestrator.

observe.system_prompt: You are an observer representing the right peg. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a clear and concise statement of the peg identity the disks present listed top to bottom and the local legal placement constraint that no larger disk can be placed on a smaller one.
observe.prompt: Your name is right_peg. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->right_peg->private_information} and the agent goal {agents->right_peg->goal} to produce a short, precise state description suitable for the orchestrator.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and you must produce the final PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the state descriptions from the pegs and the public information to construct a complete PDDL encoding of the Tower of Hanoi instance. The domain must include actions for moving a single top disk between pegs and must enforce the constraint that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk. The problem must reflect the initial state where left peg holds disks A B C D E (top to bottom) and middle and right are empty, and the goal state where right peg holds A B C D E (top to bottom) and left and middle are empty. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive the following inputs: {state_left} {state_middle} {state_right} and the public information {environment->public_information}. Use these inputs and the orchestrator goal {agents->orchestrator->goal} to produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. Keep actions distinct and explicitly name pegs left middle and right and disks A B C D E. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
